text: Yes, it is possible that you may be taking the wrong dosage of the medication or it may not be working for you.  It can also be caused by stress & anxiety, which are common sources of sleep disturbances. Medications work best when they are taken in conjunction with a regular sleep routine and avoiding stimulants like alcohol and caffeine before bedtime. You should speak about your symptoms with your doctor and get advice regarding changing your medication or adjusting your dosage. They can also check if you have any medical conditions, such as sleep apnea, restless leg syndrome, or narcolepsy, which could affect your ability to fall asleep.

Prompt_metadata.style: person with a 11th grade level of education who writes with an objective perspective
